    • Method Detail

      • getStateCreator

        public StateCreator getStateCreator()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        If the player can see the whole state, get a StateCreator that will rebuild the state as it is when this is called.

        This can be used as an immutable and repeatable deep copy of the underlying state.

        If the player cannot see the state, the StateCreator will be based on the observable state. As a result of this limited information, most agents will benefit from tracking the state themselves, in order to track, for instance, units that previously walked into or out of sight, unit upgrades based on the template values, or to incorporate their own predictions more naturally.
        Returns:
        When fog of war is on and the player is not an observer: null;
        otherwise: A StateCreator that rebuilds the underlying state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSupplyAmount

        public java.lang.Integer getSupplyAmount(int playerid)
        Get the amount of supply (food) used by a specific player.
        This is the amount presently used, it will go up with new units being created and down with them dying.
        It does not change with farms added or removed. If you are not an observer, it will not work on other people with fog of war on.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:

      • getSupplyCapMaximum

        public int getSupplyCapMaximum()
        Get the maximum amount of supply that could ever be available to any player.
        This should be used in conjunction with getSupplyCapEarned(int) to determine the effect of building a new farm/townhall.
        getSupplyCap(int) is min(getSupplyCapEarned(int), getSupplyCapMaximum())
        Returns:

      • getSupplyCap

        public java.lang.Integer getSupplyCap(int playerid)
        Get the maximum amount of supply (food) available to a specific player.
        This should be used for calculating whether another unit can be made.
        getSupplyCap(int) is min(getSupplyCapEarned(int), getSupplyCapMaximum()) If you are not an observer, it will not work on other people with fog of war on
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:

      • getSupplyCapEarned

        public java.lang.Integer getSupplyCapEarned(int playerid)
        Get the maximum amount of supply (food) earned by a specific player.
        This is the amount given by the farms and town halls or their alternatives.
        This should be used for calculating effect of farms/townhalls dying, not for calculating whether you can make a unit.
        getSupplyCap(int) is min(getSupplyCapEarned(int), getSupplyCapMaximum()) If you are not an observer, it will not work on other people with fog of war on
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:

      • getClosestOpenPosition

        public int[] getClosestOpenPosition(int x,
                           int y)
        Gets the closest position that you can see, using an outward spiraling pattern.
        This method is intended to help higher level planners to easily find open positions, as well as to predict the position of produced units or a worker that will succeed in building.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

      • hasUnit

        public boolean hasUnit(int playerNumber,
              int templateid)
        Get whether a player has a unit of a certain type. (Say, a tech building). If you are not an observer, then this will not work on other players with fog of war on
        Parameters:
        playerNumber -
        buildingtemplateid -
        Returns:
        Whether the player with id playerid has a unit with a template with the template id templateid, or false if the player is not you

      • hasUpgrade

        public boolean hasUpgrade(int upgradeid,
                 int playerid)
        Get whether a player has researched a specific upgrade. If you are not an observer, then this will not work on other players with fog of war on
        Parameters:
        upgradeid -
        playerid -
        Returns:
        Whether the player has researched an upgrade with id upgradeid. Always false if you try it on someone else.
